meanings.definition: Relating to or produced by reflection from mirrors.
meanings.sent1: The catoptric effect of the mirror made the room appear larger.
meanings.sent2: The catoptric surface of the mirror reflected the sunlight into the room.
meanings.sent3: The catoptric mirror played tricks on my eyes, making me think I saw two of everything.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the mirror had a catoptric quality, as if it could brighten up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The catoptric reflection in the mirror was so clear, it seemed like another world within it.

meanings.definition: A mirror or reflector used in optical instruments.
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the catoptric to focus the light on the specimen.
meanings.sent2: The catoptric in the telescope helped to magnify the distant stars.
meanings.sent3: The catoptric in the binoculars made everything look closer, like magic!
meanings.sent4: The catoptric in the camera lens captured the beauty of the landscape perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The catoptric reflected the image with such clarity, it was like looking through a window.
